flawed_nl_solution:
Sol will sell 10 + 4 = <<10+4=14>>14 candies on the second day.
She will sell 14 + 4 = <<14+4=13>>13 candies on the third day.
She will sell 13 + 4 = <<13+4=17>>17 candies on the fourth day.
She will sell 17 + 4 = <<17+4=21>>21 candies on the fifth day.
She will sell 21 + 4 = <<21+4=25>>25 candies on the sixth day.
She will sell a total of 10 + 14 + 13 + 17 + 21 + 25 = <<10+14+13+17+21+25=100>>100 candies in a week.
Hence, she will earn 100 x 10 = <<100*10=1000>>1000 cents.
Since 1 dollar is equal to 100 cents, then Sol will earn 1000/100 = $<<1000/100=10>>10
#### 10

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 18, not 13. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
